title: Automatic Event File Feed Generation
custom_preconds:
ProVenue User/Agency granted Sales Calendar access to Event(s)
Events enabled for Access Control
custom_steps: None required to trigger action / validate automatic event call and file publishing
custom_expected:
PVHC makes a GET event call to ProVenue everyt 4/8 hours
Events returned in the GET response are written out to an .evt file using the configured file format.
Event file is written to the configured consumer Endpoint directory

View PV logs to get the event count from the response -- use tool like json path finder to validate event Id's

custom_steps_separated.expected: login success

custom_steps_separated.content:
Find endpoint directory for the target user: 

Navigate to:  PV-HubConnect > Consumer Configuration > Consumer Endpoint
custom_steps_separated.expected: A dropdown box is presented
list of users with endpoint path is created

custom_steps_separated.content: Go to endpoint directory and validate output file
custom_steps_separated.expected: .evt file contains tab delimited list of events as expected

title: Manual Event File Feed Generation
custom_preconds:
ProVenue User/Agency granted Sales Calendar access to Event(s)
Events enabled for Access Control
custom_steps:
1.  Login to DCT Application
2.  Go To:   PV-HubConnect > User Configuration > Users / Seed Events
3.  Find target PV user (from above pre-req)
4.  Click the "Get Events" button
custom_expected:
PVHC makes a GET event call to ProVenue as a result of clicking the button
Events returned in the GET response are written out to an .evt file using the configured file format.
Event file is written to the configured consumer Endpoint directory

View PV logs to get the event count from the response -- use tool like json path finder to validate event Id's

custom_steps_separated.expected: login success

custom_steps_separated.content: Go To:   PV-HubConnect > User Configuration > Users / Seed Events
custom_steps_separated.expected: a list of users is presented

custom_steps_separated.content: Click "Get Events" button next to the target user w/ sales calendar access
custom_steps_separated.expected: a toast message is displayed "Message Published"

custom_steps_separated.content:
Find endpoint directory 

This is found by navigating to:  PV-HubConnect > Consumer Configuration > Consumer Endpoint
custom_steps_separated.expected: A dropdown box is presented
list of users with endpoint path is created

custom_steps_separated.content: Go to endpoint directory and validate output file
custom_steps_separated.expected: .evt file contains tab delimited list of events as expected

title: Scan File Generated after Scan Recorded
custom_preconds:
ProVenue User/Agency granted Sales Calendar access to Event(s)
Events enabled for Access Control
User is configured for PVHC Scan Activity Feed through DCT
PV Application properties set to enable Scan Feed
custom_test_purpose: verify scan file produced after scan recorded
custom_steps:
1.  Print tickets to an upcoming event meeting the criteria of preconditions
2.  Use postman to validate tickets 
----- ensure you are using correct scan facility, scan area, and scan device codes
---- optional:  change the access control schedule to make tickets scan valid.
custom_expected:
A scan record is recorded (http 200 response from postman API call)
--- not barcode and result code
A .scan file is written to the consumer endpoint directory

custom_steps_separated.expected: login success

custom_steps_separated.content:
Find endpoint directory for User Configured for Scan Activity Feed

This is found by navigating to:  PV-HubConnect > Consumer Configuration > Consumer Endpoint
custom_steps_separated.expected: A dropdown box is presented
list of users with endpoint path is created

custom_steps_separated.content: Go to endpoint directory and validate output file
custom_steps_separated.expected: .scan file contains tab delimited scan result

title: Verify deleting jobs from PV and salesforce and check the delete job behaviour in next series
custom_steps:
1. user should be logged into PV application
2. Patron shoudl be successfully created
3. Patron should be able to successfully complete a 
sale with sales rep.
4. User should be logged into salesforce application
5. Patron details should be refelected in salesforce
6. User shoudl be login to delete the asscoiated trait
7. user should be able to delete the trait before the 
job runs
8. it should not call the same salesforce 
query  which it is called in previous job.

custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Login to PV application.
2. Create a new patron mapping patron trait.
3. Complete a sale for the patron with sale rep 
mapped to the order.
4. Navigate to salesforce application
5. Verify the patron created and corresponding 
patron details are reflected in salesforce 
application.
6. Now login back to PV application and delete the trait asssociated to the patron.
7. Navigate to salesforce application and delete the trait before the job runs
8. verify the logs in next series.

title: Verify DB message queue retries delivering a message 20 times and then only moves to the next batch.
custom_steps:
1. In db message, since batch value is set as 5 only 
those 5 orders should be reprocessed and once 
the rety count is 20.Then only the next bacth 
should be started
2. PVHC logs shoudl display only 5 messages being 
processed and those shoudl be displayed in 
PVHC logs too
3. Prerequiste should be set
4. Userr should be landing in PVHC application.
5. user should be landed in  DB Message Queue page

custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Verify the orders are picked based on the 
value set in the property.
2. Verify in PVHC logs, the batch is pulled based 
on the values set in the property
3. 1.Default value(5) to be set to the the property 
"dbmessage.queue.batch.size" 
2.Make a createoffer order to fail, by changing 
the supplierCode value in 
PV-Hubconnect-->Client configuration-->Property 
management.
3.Create 10 orders such that it fails
4. Login to DCT application
5. Navigate to PV-HubConnect > DB Message Queue
